title: 14 Days : High alert
message:
On March 29, Israeli strikes on Aleppo killed 42 people, including a top Hezbollah figure, Reuters reported.
On March 27, Zaher Bashara, 38, from a Druze village, was killed when Hezbollah launched a barrage of rockets at Kiryat Shmona.
GAZA WAROn April 7, the IDF announced that 604 soldiers and more than 12,000 terrorists had been killed since October 7.
The last casualties before the IDF withdrew all forces from the southern Gaza Strip were Capt.
Security forces killed the terrorist, a 26-year-old from Tira.

title: Hezbollah says it fired drones and guided missiles at northern Israel
message:
April 28, 2024 10:30 pm | Updated 10:30 pm IST - BeirutLebanon’s Iran-backed Hezbollah movement said on Saturday it had targeted northern Israel with drones and guided missiles after cross-border Israeli strikes killed three people, including two of its members.
The Israeli Army said its Iron Dome air-defence system “successfully intercepted a suspicious aerial target that crossed from Lebanon into the area of Manara in northern Israel”.
The Army also “struck the sources of fire” of several anti-tank missiles launched from Lebanon into the Manara border area, it added.
Overnight Saturday to Sunday Hezbollah said it had launched dozens of rockets at the Israeli military base at Meron, northern Israel.
Hezbollah has intensified its targeting of military sites in Israel since tensions soared between Israel and Iran over the bombing of Tehran’s Damascus consulate on April 1, widely blamed on Israel.
event_breakdown:
- Hezbollah, backed by Iran, targeted northern Israel with drones and guided missiles following cross-border Israeli strikes that killed three people, including two Hezbollah members.
- The Israeli Army's Iron Dome air-defense system intercepted a suspicious aerial target that crossed from Lebanon into the area of Manara in northern Israel.
- The Army struck the sources of fire of several anti-tank missiles launched from Lebanon into the Manara border area.
- Overnight, Hezbollah launched dozens of rockets at the Israeli military base at Meron, northern Israel.
- Tensions between Israel and Iran escalated following the bombing of Tehran’s Damascus consulate on April 1, widely attributed to Israel, leading to intensified targeting of military sites by Hezbollah.

title: A new type of warfare - Newspaper
message:
SOME strange yet interesting lessons in the history of warfare surfaced during the recent Iranian attack on Israel.
Indeed, telling the US meant telling Israel, the target, itself.
Moreover, the definitions of ‘limited war’, ‘proxy war’ ‘asymmetric war’ are also frequently changing now, and along with it the weapons of war are also undergoing a metamorphosis.
The most commonly used weapons of war now are missiles, precision-guided weapons, rockets and drones.
The world is rapidly moving towards modern warfare tactics.
event_breakdown:
- Iranian attack on Israel
- Telling the US meant telling Israel
- Changing definitions of ‘limited war’, ‘proxy war’, ‘asymmetric war’
- Evolution of weapons used in warfare towards missiles, precision-guided weapons, rockets, and drones
- Rapid movement towards modern warfare tactics

title: Hezbollah fires dozens of rockets at Israel Meron in response to attacks
message:
Hezbollah said it fired overnight dozens of Katyusha rockets at Israel's Meron settlement and nearby areas in response to attacks on Lebanese towns and civilian homes, especially in Qawzah, Markaba and Srebbine.
On Saturday, Hezbollah said it targeted northern Israel with drones and guided missiles after cross-border Israeli strikes killed three people, including two of its members.
The army also "struck the sources of fire" of several anti-tank missiles launched from Lebanon into the Manara border area, it added.
Earlier Saturday, Israeli fighter jets "struck a Hezbollah military structure in the area of Qawzah in southern Lebanon," the Israeli army said in a statement.
In two separate statements earlier Saturday, Hezbollah mourned the deaths of two fighters from the villages of Kfar Kila and Khiam.

title: Richard D . Fisher On Taiwan : Surviving The Next Four Years
message:
Richard D. Fisher On Taiwan: Surviving The Next Four YearsFor the incoming Administration of President-elect William Lai (賴清德), successfully deterring a Chinese Communist Party (CCP) attack or invasion of democratic Taiwan over his four-year term would be a clear victory.
But it could also be a curse, because during those four years the CCP’s People’s Liberation Army (PLA) will grow far stronger.
As such, increased vigilance in Washington and Taipei will be needed to ensure that already multiplying CCP threat trends don’t overwhelm Taiwan, the United States, and their democratic allies.
First it is necessary to acknowledge that short of actual shooting, the CCP is at war with the United States, Taiwan, and most other democracies.
Richard D. Fisher, Jr. is a senior fellow with the International Assessment and Strategy Center.
event_breakdown:
- Richard D. Fisher emphasizes the importance of deterring a Chinese Communist Party (CCP) attack on Taiwan during President-elect William Lai's term.
- Success in deterring such an attack would be significant but could also pose challenges due to the strengthening of the CCP's People's Liberation Army (PLA) over the four-year period.
- Increased vigilance is required in Washington and Taipei to counter multiplying CCP threat trends and prevent overwhelming Taiwan, the United States, and their democratic allies.
- Fisher asserts that the CCP is effectively at war with the United States, Taiwan, and most other democracies.

title: Hamas claims rocket barrage from Lebanon into north Israel
message:
AdvertisementAccording to a Telegram announcement from the Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades, Hamas forces “have fired a concentrated rocket barrage from south Lebanon towards” an Israeli military position.
As a “response to the massacres of the Zionist enemy (Israel)” in Gaza and the occupied West Bank, the armed wing explained the attack.
The latest rocket barrage came as Hamas negotiators were expected to arrive in Egypt on Monday, where they were due to respond to Israel’s latest proposal for a long-sought truce in Gaza and hostage release.
On April 21, the Qassam Brigades claimed a rocket barrage into northern Israel.
A strike in January, which a US defence official said was carried out by Israel, killed Hamas deputy leader Saleh al-Aruri and six other militants in Hezbollah’s south Beirut stronghold.
event_breakdown:
1. Hamas forces fired a rocket barrage from south Lebanon towards an Israeli military position in response to the massacres of the Zionist enemy in Gaza and the occupied West Bank.
2. The Qassam Brigades claimed a rocket barrage into northern Israel on April 21.
3. A strike in January, attributed to Israel by a US defense official, killed Hamas deputy leader Saleh al-Aruri and six other militants in Hezbollah's south Beirut stronghold.

title: Israeli military hit 270 Gaza terror targets since start of Passover Holiday
message:
Tel Aviv [Israel], April 28 (ANI/TPS): The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) said that over the first six day of the Passover holiday its forces attacked about 270 terrorist targets throughout the Gaza Strip, of which more than 20 were terror infrastructures that were aimed at the territory of Israel.
In the attacks rocket launch sites were destroyed.
In addition, the IDF attacked a launch site located in the designated humanitarian area in the southern Gaza Strip, using Israel Air Force aircraft.
The launch site was loaded and attacked before it could launch rockets at Israeli territory.
The IDF said that this was "further evidence of Hamas's cynical use of civilian spaces for terrorist purposes."
event_breakdown:
1. Tel Aviv [Israel], April 28: Israel Defence Forces (IDF) attacked about 270 terrorist targets in Gaza Strip.
2. Rocket launch sites were destroyed in the attacks.
3. IDF attacked a launch site in the southern Gaza Strip, located in a designated humanitarian area.
4. The launch site was loaded and attacked before it could launch rockets at Israeli territory.
5. IDF stated that this action showed Hamas's cynical use of civilian spaces for terrorist activities.

title: Somalia - Six Hormuud Telecom Staff Killed in Tragic Mogadishu Blast
message:
Mogadishu, Somalia — On the afternoon of April 28, 2024, a devastating explosion rocked the outskirts of Mogadishu, Somalia, claiming the lives of six employees of Hormuud Telecom, the country's largest telecommunications company.
Hormuud Telecom confirmed the deaths of their staff members in a statement expressing deep condolences to the families, friends, and colleagues of the victims.
The explosion is part of a disturbing pattern of violence against commercial companies in Somalia, with Hormuud Telecom being a frequent target.
Hormuud Telecom has vowed to continue its operations despite the challenges, emphasizing its commitment to providing essential telecommunications services to the Somali people.
As the investigation into the attack continues, the families of the victims and the entire Hormuud Telecom community mourn the loss of their colleagues, friends, and loved ones.
event_breakdown:
- A devastating explosion occurred on the outskirts of Mogadishu, Somalia, on April 28, 2024, claiming the lives of six employees of Hormuud Telecom.
- Hormuud Telecom confirmed the deaths of its staff members and extended condolences to the victims' families, friends, and colleagues.
- The explosion is part of a concerning trend of violence targeting commercial companies in Somalia, with Hormuud Telecom being a frequent victim.
- Hormuud Telecom has pledged to continue its operations despite the challenges, emphasizing its commitment to providing essential telecommunications services to the Somali people.
- Investigations into the attack are ongoing as the families of the victims and the entire Hormuud Telecom community mourn the loss of their colleagues, friends, and loved ones.

title: A three - dimensional view of the Israel - Iran crisis
message:
“Iran, Iran, Iran,” responded the Prime Minister.
Mr. Netanyahu, Israel’s longest-serving Prime Minister, has never minced words about Iran.
And Israel’s response to the Iran attack was rather “feeble”, as Mr. Netanyahu’s National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir himself called it.
And then, Mr. Biden told Mr. Netanyahu that the U.S. would not participate in any Israeli retaliation against Iran.
But when Mr. Biden told him that the U.S. would not join Israel’s retaliation, it limited Mr. Netanyahu’s options.

title: Hezbollah Says Fires Drones , Guided Missiles At Israel In Retaliatory Strike
message:
The border between Lebanon and Israel has seen near-daily exchanges of fire (Representational)Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah movement said Saturday it had targeted northern Israel with drones and guided missiles after cross-border Israeli strikes killed three people, including two of its members.
The army also "struck the sources of fire" of several anti-tank missiles launched from Lebanon into the Manara border area, it added.
Earlier Saturday, Israeli fighter jets "struck a Hezbollah military structure in the area of Qouzah in southern Lebanon," the army said in a statement.
The border between Lebanon and Israel has seen near-daily exchanges of fire since the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza began nearly seven months ago.
Hezbollah has intensified its targeting of military sites in Israel since tensions soared between Israel and Iran over the bombing of Tehran's Damascus consulate on April 1, widely blamed on Israel.
event_breakdown:
- Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah movement targeted northern Israel with drones and guided missiles after cross-border Israeli strikes killed three people, including two of its members.
- Israeli army struck the sources of fire after several anti-tank missiles were launched from Lebanon into the Manara border area.
- Earlier on Saturday, Israeli fighter jets struck a Hezbollah military structure in the area of Qouzah in southern Lebanon.
- The border between Lebanon and Israel has seen near-daily exchanges of fire since the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza began nearly seven months ago.
- Hezbollah has intensified its targeting of military sites in Israel since tensions soared between Israel and Iran over the bombing of Tehran's Damascus consulate on April 1, widely blamed on Israel.

title: Israel - Hamas : Biden speaks with Netanyahu as Mideast tensions in U . S . mount
message:
President Joe Biden (L) listens to Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu as he joins a meeting of the Israeli war cabinet in Tel Aviv.
President Joe Biden held a phone call on Sunday with Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu against the backdrop of growing U.S. college campus protests and a possibly imminent invasion of Rafah.
Netanyahu shows no signs of backing away from a ground offensive there — a potential move that the U.S. publicly opposes.
Sunday's conversation was Biden and Netanyahu's first phone call since April 4, when Biden spoke with Netanyahu after an Israeli airstrike killed seven World Central Kitchen humanitarian workers.
Biden said in early April that he thinks Netanyahu is making a "mistake" with his handling of the war, adding, "I don't agree with his approach."
event_breakdown:
- President Joe Biden holds phone call with Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Tel Aviv
- President Joe Biden expresses disagreement with Netanyahu's approach to the war

title: Biden speaks with Netanyahu as tensions over the Israel - Hamas war mount in the US
message:
WASHINGTON — President Joe Biden held a phone call on Sunday with Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu against the backdrop of growing U.S. college campus protests and a possibly imminent invasion of Rafah.
Netanyahu shows no signs of backing away from a ground offensive there — a potential move that the U.S. publicly opposes.
Sunday's conversation was Biden and Netanyahu's first phone call since April 4, when Biden spoke with Netanyahu after an Israeli airstrike killed seven World Central Kitchen humanitarian workers.
During the earlier April call, Biden "emphasized that the strikes on humanitarian workers and the overall humanitarian situation are unacceptable," according to the White House readout.
Biden said in early April that he thinks Netanyahu is making a “mistake” with his handling of the war, adding, “I don’t agree with his approach.”
event_breakdown:
- President Joe Biden held a phone call with Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu
- Growing U.S. college campus protests
- Possible imminent invasion of Rafah
- Netanyahu shows no signs of backing away from a ground offensive in Rafah
- Sunday's conversation between Biden and Netanyahu was their first phone call since April 4
- Israeli airstrike killed seven World Central Kitchen humanitarian workers on April 4
- Biden emphasized that the strikes on humanitarian workers and the overall humanitarian situation are unacceptable during the April call
- Biden expressed disagreement with Netanyahu's handling of the war

title: Court Arrests 12th Suspect in Crocus City Hall Attack Case
message:
Court Arrests 12th Suspect in Crocus City Hall Attack CaseSputnik News20240427MOSCOW (Sputnik) - The Basmanny District Court of Moscow has arrested Dzhumokhon Kurbonov, the twelfth defendant in the Crocus City Hall terrorist attack case, who will remain in custody until May 22, a Sputnik correspondent reported on Saturday.
So far, 11 defendants have been charged with committing a terrorist attack resulting in death as part of an organized group under paragraph b of Part 3 of Article 205 of the Russian criminal code.
Kurbonov allegedly provided his accomplices with means of communication and money to pay bills, the Moscow City Court said.
On March 22, several armed men broke into the Crocus City Hall concert venue near Moscow and started shooting indiscriminately at concert-goers.
The main suspects in the case tried to flee the scene in a car but were detained and charged with terrorism.

title: Terrorist  sent to hell  after gun battle with security forces in Balochistan Harnai
message:
A terrorist was killed and another was injured in a gun battle between security forces and militants trying to intercept civilian vehicles on Sanjavi Road in Balochistan's district Harnai, the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) said on Saturday.
The exchange of fire took place today (April 27) as the security forces reacted immediately and effectively engaged the terrorists, the military's media wing added.
The ISPR said that the timely response by the security forces thwarted nefarious intent of the terrorists, saving innocent lives.
On Thursday, the security forces killed three terrorists including two ringleaders Sohail aka Azmato and Haji Gul alias Zarkavi in an intelligence-based operation (IBO) in Khyber district.
As per the ISPR, the operation was conducted by the security forces on April 24-25 on the reported presence of terrorists in the KP's tribal district.
event_breakdown:
- A terrorist was killed and another was injured in a gun battle on Sanjavi Road in Balochistan's district Harnai.
- The security forces engaged the militants trying to intercept civilian vehicles.
- The exchange of fire occurred on April 27, with the security forces reacting immediately and effectively.
- The timely response by the security forces thwarted the terrorists' nefarious intent, saving innocent lives.
- Security forces conducted an intelligence-based operation in Khyber district on April 24-25.
- Three terrorists, including ringleaders Sohail aka Azmato and Haji Gul alias Zarkavi, were killed in the operation.

title: Hamas reviewing Israeli proposal for Gaza cease - fire
message:
CAIRO — Hamas said Saturday it was reviewing a new Israeli proposal for a cease-fire in Gaza, as Egypt intensified efforts to broker a deal to end the monthslong war and stave off a planned Israeli ground offensive into the southern city of Rafah.
Hamas previously said it won't back down from demands for a permanent cease-fire and full withdrawal of Israeli troops.
The Israeli military massed dozens of tanks and armored vehicles in southern Israel close to Rafah and hits the city with near-daily airstrikes.
An Israeli airstrike later Saturday on a building in Rafah killed seven people, including six members of the Ashour family, according to the morgue.
Gaza war protests ignite on US college campuses
event_breakdown:
1. Hamas reviewing new Israeli proposal for cease-fire in Gaza
2. Egyptian efforts to broker a deal to end the monthslong war
3. Israeli military massing tanks and armored vehicles close to Rafah
4. Israeli airstrikes hitting Rafah with near-daily attacks
5. Israeli airstrike in Rafah kills seven, including six members of Ashour family
6. Gaza war protests ignite on US college campuses

title: Daughter of prominent Palestinian poet killed in Israeli airstrike in Gaza - LocalNews8 . com
message:
Eyewitnesses in Al-Rimal neighborhood told CNN that three Israeli missiles struck a home where the family were sheltering.
Shaima was the daughter of Palestinian poet Refaat Alareer, who was killed along with several other family members when an Israeli airstrike hit their home in the Shujayya neighborhood in December.
Video shot for CNN shows residents running towards the house after the strike and gathering around the bodies of those killed.
Residents told CNN the family’s remains were taken to Al-Ahli Baptist Hospital.
Journalist Mohammad Al Sawalhi contributed reporting from central Gaza, as did Khader Al-Za’anoun of Wafa, the official Palestinian news agency.
event_breakdown:
1. Three Israeli missiles struck a home in the Al-Rimal neighborhood where a family was sheltering.
2. Israeli airstrike hit the home of Palestinian poet Refaat Alareer in the Shujayya neighborhood, resulting in the death of several family members including his daughter Shaima in December.
3. Residents ran towards the house after the strike and gathered around the bodies of those killed, as shown in a video shot for CNN.
4. The family's remains were taken to Al-Ahli Baptist Hospital.
5. Journalist Mohammad Al Sawalhi contributed reporting from central Gaza, along with Khader Al-Za’anoun of Wafa, the official Palestinian news agency.

title: Security forces eliminate two terrorists in DI Khan IBO
message:
— AFP/FileThe security forces on Sunday eliminated two terrorists involved in target killing and extortion in an intelligence-based operation (IBO) in Dera Ismail Khan District of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) said.
As per the military’s media wing, the security forces conducted the IBO in Dera Ismail Khan on the reported presence of terrorists.
The ISPR reaffirmed Pakistan security forces’ determination to wipe-out the menace of terrorism from the country.
On Saturday, the security forces killed a terrorist and injured another in a gun battle in Balochistan's district Harnai, the ISPR stated.
The exchange of fire took place as the security forces reacted immediately and effectively engaged the terrorists trying to intercept civilian vehicles on Sanjavi Road, it added.
location: The primary location where the main event is taking place is Dera Ismail Khan District of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan.
event_breakdown:
- Security forces eliminate two terrorists in intelligence-based operation in Dera Ismail Khan District of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
- Security forces conduct IBO in Dera Ismail Khan on reported presence of terrorists
- ISPR reaffirms Pakistan security forces' determination to wipe out terrorism
- Security forces kill a terrorist and injure another in gun battle in Balochistan's district Harnai
- Exchange of fire as security forces engage terrorists trying to intercept civilian vehicles on Sanjavi Road

title: Pakistan : Two terrorists shot dead by security forces in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
message:
In an intense exchange of gunfire with the security forces, two terrorists were killed in the Dera Ismail Khan district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on Sunday, Geo News reported citing the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR).
As per the military's media wing, the security forces conducted an intelligence-based operation in Dera Ismail Khan on the reported presence of terrorists in the area.
The ISPR reaffirmed Pakistan's security forces' determination to wipe out the menace of terrorism from the country, according to Geo News.
On Saturday as well, the security forces killed a terrorist and injured another in a gun battle in Balochistan's district Harnai, Geo News reported.
The exchange of fire took place as the security forces reacted and effectively engaged the terrorists trying to intercept civilian vehicles on Sanjavi Road, it added.
event_breakdown:
- Intense exchange of gunfire with security forces in Dera Ismail Khan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa resulting in the deaths of two terrorists
- Security forces conducting an intelligence-based operation in Dera Ismail Khan on reported presence of terrorists
- Security forces killing a terrorist and injuring another in a gun battle in Balochistan's district Harnai
- Engagement of security forces with terrorists trying to intercept civilian vehicles on Sanjavi Road

title: World Central Kitchen will resume feeding operations in Gaza weeks after deadly Israeli strike
message:
World Central Kitchen said it plans to restart aid operations in Gaza on Monday after halting its relief efforts when an Israeli airstrike killed seven of its workers on April 1.
Prior to the airstrike, World Central Kitchen had distributed more than 43 millions in Gaza, the charity said.
Israel at War World Central Kitchen saves lives with food but paid a price in blood AP via Scripps News“The humanitarian situation in Gaza remains dire,” said Erin Gore, World Central Kitchen’s chief executive officer.
World Central Kitchen plans to open a third, high-production kitchen in the region.
Or keep feeding knowing that aid, aid workers and civilians are being intimidated and killed,” Gore said in a statement.

- Israeli airstrike killed seven World Central Kitchen workers in Gaza

- The humanitarian situation in Gaza remains dire, according to World Central Kitchen's CEO
- Aid workers and civilians are being intimidated and killed in Gaza

title: Hamas is reviewing an Israeli proposal for a cease - fire in Gaza , as a planned Rafah offensive looms
message:
CAIRO — Hamas said Saturday it was reviewing a new Israeli proposal for a cease-fire in Gaza, as Egypt intensified efforts to broker a deal to end the monthslong war and stave off a planned Israeli ground offensive into the southern city of Rafah.
Hamas has said it won’t back down from demands for a permanent cease-fire and full withdrawal of Israeli troops.
The Israeli military has massed dozens of tanks and armored vehicles in southern Israel close to Rafah and hit locations in the city in near-daily airstrikes.
An Israeli airstrike later Saturday on a building in Rafah killed seven people, including six members of the Ashour family, according to the morgue.
Israel’s military confirmed Saturday that it would be operational by early May.

The Israeli military has massed dozens of tanks and armored vehicles in southern Israel close to Rafah, and hit locations in the city in near-daily airstrikes.

title: Israeli officials concerned about possible ICC arrest warrants as pressure mounts over war in Gaza
message:
×JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli officials appeared increasingly concerned that the International Criminal Court may issue arrest warrants against the country’s leaders, as international pressure mounts over the war in Gaza.
Meanwhile, Israeli officials have referred in recent days to an ICC probe launched three years ago into possible war crimes committed by Israel and Palestinian militants going back to the 2014 Israel-Hamas war.
There was no comment from the court on Monday, and it has given no indication warrants in the case are imminent.
But Israel’s Foreign Ministry said late Sunday that it had informed Israeli missions of “rumors” that warrants might be issued against senior political and military officials.
Foreign Minister Israel Katz said any such warrants would “provide a morale boost” to Hamas and other militant groups.
location:
Reminder: My knowledge cut-off date is January 2022.

Hamas

- Foreign Minister Israel Katz's statement on potential warrants

title: Ghana needs new counter - terrorism Act to tackle radicalised youth – CISA
message:
It was on the theme: “The Media and Security in an Election Year.”The Ghana Anti-Terrorism Act, 2008, Act 762, is the principal legislation that underlines the legal framework on Violent Extremism and Terrorism in Ghana.
“The absence of Foreign Fighters Act is worrying as more Ghanaian youth run to war zones, terrorist cells; and return as radicalised lone wolves or form sleeper cells,” Mr Inusah said.
“It is now time for most countries in Africa, especially Ghana, to consider the urgent need to address these concerns through the enactment of new counter-terrorism legislation (Foreign Fighters Act.
“The FFA will bestow the law enforcement agencies with the powers to take effective action in advance of any terrorist act being committed,” he added.
It uses various tools, including systematic research and publication of articles by CISA analysts and seasoned security and intelligence practitioners to achieve its goals.

title: Terrorists gun down VDG member in Udhampur
message:
A member of the Village Defence Group (VDG) was on Sunday killed in a gunfight with terrorists in the Udhampur district of Jammu.
The deceased, Mohammad Sharief (48 years), sustained critical injuries in the exchange of gunfire with terrorists and passed away later, police said.
AdvertisementIn a post on X, ADGP (Jammu Range) Anand Jain said: “The J&K Police swiftly responded to intelligence inputs on terrorists near the Basantgarh police station in Udhampur district.
A clash ensued as the police confronted the hiding terrorists, resulting in one VDC member sustaining injuries.
One VDG member sustained injuries in the initial exchange of firing.

title: As US pulls troops from Niger and Chad , what happens to counterterrorism ?
message:
Niger and Chad are two of the poorest countries on the planet.
Shortly after, the junta tore up the decadelong security agreement Niger had with Washington and ordered the roughly 1,000 U.S. troops in the country to leave.
Chad, thought to be a reliable U.S. security partner in the Sahel, is putting pressure on Washington as well.
Deep down, however, it’s not entirely clear why the U.S. should be freaking about leaving Niger and possibly Chad.
Also, realistically speaking, staying in a country whose government no longer wants U.S. troops there is an unsustainable situation.
event_breakdown:
1. Niger and Chad identified as two of the poorest countries on the planet.
2. The junta tears up a security agreement between Niger and Washington, ordering 1,000 U.S. troops to leave the country.
3. Chad, previously considered a reliable U.S. security partner in the Sahel, puts pressure on Washington.
4. Uncertainty arises over the reasons for the U.S. concern about leaving Niger and Chad.
5. Staying in a country where the government no longer wants U.S. troops is deemed unsustainable.

Hamas has said it won't back down from demands for a permanent cease-fire and full withdrawal of Israeli troops.
There is growing international pressure for Hamas and Israel to reach a cease-fire deal and avert an Israeli attack on Rafah, where more than half of Gaza's 2.3 million people have sought refuge.

title: World Central Kitchen will resume operations in Gaza after killing of 7 aid workers
message:
World Central Kitchen announced that it will resume operations in Gaza on Monday, almost one month after seven of its aid workers were killed in an Israeli airstrike in the enclave.
The IDF took full responsibility for killing the aid workers, saying it was the result of soldiers mistaking them for Hamas gunmen.
A car used by World Central Kitchen that was hit by an Israeli strike the previous day is pictured in Deir al-Balah, Gaza, on April 2.
A hole is blasted through the roof of a World Central Kitchen vehicle, pictured on April 2, the day after an Israeli strike in Deir al-Balah, Gaza.
Gore, the charity's chief executive officer, says WCK was “forced to make a decision: Stop feeding altogether during one of the worst hunger crises ever” or “keep feeding knowing that aid, aid workers and civilians are being intimidated and killed.”“These are the hardest conversations, and we have considered all perspectives when deliberating,” Gore said.
event_breakdown:
- World Central Kitchen announces resumption of operations in Gaza after aid workers killed
- IDF takes responsibility for killing aid workers in Gaza

- World Central Kitchen CEO discusses challenges faced in providing aid in Gaza

title: My struggle to keep family safe while covering Gaza war
message:
I looked at the faces of my wife and children, huddled in the bitter cold in Khan Younis in southern Gaza, and felt helpless.
Eventually, my family moved to an apartment in Nuseirat in central Gaza, while I stayed with the BBC team in a tent at Nasser hospital in Khan Younis.
The Israeli military says it takes "feasible precautions" to reduce civilian casualties, and in this case had "targeted Hamas terrorist infrastructure in the area".
After that terrifying and surreal journey south, and our night outside the Red Crescent headquarters, I continued working from Khan Younis for several weeks.
The Israeli military also closed the main road leading north, which connected me and my family.
location:
Reminder: My knowledge cut-off date is January 2022.

The primary location where the main event is taking place is Khan Younis in southern Gaza.

- BBC team staying in a tent at Nasser hospital in Khan Younis

- Working from Khan Younis for several weeks after a terrifying journey

title: Hezbollah says fires drones and guided missiles at Israel
message:
Lebanon’s Iran-backed Hezbollah movement said Saturday it had targeted northern Israel with drones and guided missiles after cross-border Israeli strikes killed three people, including two of its members.
The Israeli army said its Iron Dome air-defence system “successfully intercepted a suspicious aerial target that crossed from Lebanon into the area of Manara in northern Israel”.
The army also “struck the sources of fire” of several anti-tank missiles launched from Lebanon into the Manara border area, it added.
Overnight Saturday to Sunday Hezbollah said it had launched dozens of rockets at the Israeli military base at Meron, northern Israel.
An Israeli army statement said its Iron Dome system had succeeded in intercepting missiles fired towards northern Israel from Lebanon’s al-Manara region.
event_breakdown:
- Hezbollah targets northern Israel with drones and guided missiles
- Israeli Iron Dome intercepts aerial target from Lebanon
- Israeli army strikes sources of fire of anti-tank missiles from Lebanon
- Hezbollah launches dozens of rockets at Israeli military base at Meron
- Israeli Iron Dome intercepts missiles fired from Lebanon's al-Manara region

title: Hamas claims rocket barrage from Lebanon into north Israel
message:
Hamas' armed wing the Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades fired Monday a barrage of rockets from south Lebanon toward a command center in northern Israel.
Hamas fighters "have fired a concentrated rocket barrage from south Lebanon towards" an Israeli military position, said the Ezzedine al-Qassam Brigades in a statement on Telegram.
Hamas' rocket barrage came as Hamas negotiators were expected to arrive in Egypt on Monday, where they were due to respond to Israel's latest proposal for a long-sought truce in Gaza and hostage release.
On April 21, the Qassam Brigades claimed a rocket barrage into northern Israel.
An Israeli strike later in March killed a Hamas operative near the Palestinian refugee camp of Rashidiyeh in the Tyre district.

title: Abducted Senior Judge Released In Northwestern Pakistan
message:
The ruling Georgian Dream party has argued that the legislation would bring transparency among NGOs and combat what they call "values imposed by foreigners."
The decision to expel the seven was made by session chairman Anri Okhanashvili of Georgian Dream, who cited what he said were "violations" of parliamentary procedures.
Several other members of the opposition were not allowed to finish their speeches against the piece of legislation advanced by Georgian Dream.
The ruling Georgian Dream party introduced the legislation in 2023 but was forced to withdraw it following mass protests.

title: Australia raids radical suspects following church stabbing
message:
(MENAFN) In a significant counter-terrorism operation, Australian law enforcement officers detained seven individuals in Sydney on Wednesday, involving the collaboration of over 400 local, state, and federal authorities.
The operation was initiated in response to the stabbing of an Assyrian Christian bishop earlier this month, which authorities have classified as a terrorist incident.
New South Wales Police Deputy Commissioner David Hudson addressed reporters, explaining that the raids were conducted as a follow-up to the initial stabbing incident, during which several associates were identified and deemed to require further investigation.
However, the behavior of the detained individuals led authorities to believe that an attack may have been imminent, prompting the pre-emptive detention operation.
The operation underscores the ongoing efforts of Australian authorities to address threats posed by extremist ideologies and to ensure the safety and security of the public.

title: Iran Teases New Drone Visually Similar to Russia Lancet
message:
Iran Teases New Drone Visually Similar to Russia's LancetSputnik News20240428Ilya TsukanovKicking off its foray into drone design and manufacturing in the 1980s during the Iran-Iraq War, Iran has gone on to create more than 50 different kinds of unmanned aerial vehicles, from reconnaissance and strike drones to loitering munitions.
Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps has teased a new drone design apparently taking cues from Russia's distinct X-winged Lancet series of loitering munitions.
Russia's Lancet DronesThe Russian loitering munitions going under the name "Lancet" actually constitute an entire lineup of kamikaze drones, all of them featuring a distinctive single or dual X-wing design.
In February, Ukraine announced that it would begin the production of its own Lancet-style drone, signaling a begrudging recognition of the Russian UAV design's potential.
Iran's DronesIran's drone manufacturers have created over 50 different drone designs, from short-range tactical UAVs and loitering munitions to rocket and propeller-powered long-range reconnaissance, attack and electronic warfare drones.

title: Hamas reviewing new Israeli cease - fire proposal amid growing international pressure
message:
Senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya gave no details of Israel's offer, but said it was in response to a Hamas proposal two weeks ago.
Hamas has said it won't back down from demands for a permanent cease-fire and full withdrawal of Israeli troops.
There is growing international pressure for Hamas and Israel to reach a cease-fire deal and avert an Israeli attack on Rafah, where more than half of Gaza's 2.3 million people have sought refuge.
An Israeli airstrike later Saturday on a building in Rafah killed seven people, including six members of the Ashour family, according to the morgue.
Israel's military confirmed Saturday that it would be operational by early May.
location: Reminder: My knowledge cut-off date is January 2022. Based on the information provided, the main event is taking place in Rafah, Gaza.
event_breakdown:
- Senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya mentioned Israel's offer in response to a Hamas proposal two weeks ago.
- Hamas reiterated its demands for a permanent cease-fire and full withdrawal of Israeli troops.
- Growing international pressure for Hamas and Israel to reach a cease-fire deal to prevent an Israeli attack on Rafah.
- An Israeli airstrike in Rafah resulted in the death of seven people, including six members of the Ashour family.
- Israel's military confirmed that it would be operational by early May.

title: BBC Gaza reporter : My struggle to keep family safe while covering the war
message:
The BBC Arabic reporter shares the harrowing moments he faced covering a war that pushed him to his limits.
I looked at the faces of my wife and children, huddled in the bitter cold in Khan Younis in southern Gaza, and felt helpless.
In Khan Younis, the BBC team - about seven of us - lived on one meal a day.
The Israeli military says it takes "feasible precautions" to reduce civilian casualties, and in this case had "targeted Hamas terrorist infrastructure in the area".
[BBC]Reporting Gaza: My WarIn Gaza, Palestinian journalists document the war as they live it on a daily basis.

title: Hamas reviewing Israeli ceasefire proposal as possible Rafah offensive looms
message:
Hamas said on Saturday it was reviewing a new Israeli proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza, as Egypt intensified efforts to broker a deal to end the months-long war and stave off a possible Israeli ground offensive into the southern Gaza city of Rafah.
Senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya said the Palestinian militant group was evaluating Israel’s proposal, and “upon completion of its study, it will submit its response”.
AdvertisementHe gave no details of Israel’s offer but said it was in response to a proposal from Hamas two weeks ago.
Negotiations earlier this month centred on a six-week ceasefire proposal and the release of 40 civilian and sick hostages in exchange for freeing hundreds of Palestinian prisoners in Israeli jails.
Since then, 491 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the territory according to the Ramallah-based health ministry.
event_breakdown:
- Hamas reviewing new Israeli proposal for ceasefire in Gaza
- Senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya evaluating Israel's proposal and planning to submit a response
- Negotiations earlier this month focused on a six-week ceasefire proposal and a prisoner exchange deal
- 491 Palestinians killed by Israeli fire in the territory according to Ramallah-based health ministry
